Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sha256(origseed + %d)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: knowing any specific sha256 value wont let you calculate any other. the origseed of course is critical and generates all the privkeys

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: replace sha256 with whatever other crypto strength hashing, you can also make origseed composed out of multiple parts, each of them hashes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just depends on how far you want to go

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I had one idea where you made a single passphrase and then randomly flipped bits in it. then you dont directly know where the coins are, but given the origseed you are able to mine them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so put a small amount in the direct address from the original seed and the rest in the mineable addresses

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I like it. Sounds kind of like giving yourself a map and burying treasure

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: nodeJS wallets look cool, but the security issues really do concern me. I don't think I want to maintain the hush-ng nodeJS codebase and I want switch to a QT+RPC codebase. So I am looking at all my options, and making my upstream something that is funded by Zcash foundation doesn't sound like a horrible idea

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @mrlynch there is no rush for invoice CC, until just now, didnt even have it on the actively developed list. before you start in on it, make sure it has some cool features, like automatic payments to authorized invoicers (up to a cap per time period)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way, it can be used to authorize payments of monthly bills and the burden of invoicing and collecting is on the billings side. which means the biller would need to be able to create the transaction

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i made a nice little CLI util that generates bip39 wallet seed phrases in 0.005s with secure entropy provided by libsodium

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: trezor-crypto and libsodium does all the heavy lifting, but it taught me some good stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i was getting RNG data incorrectly and my seed phrases, every one, had the word abandon 4 times in them, and always started with a word that started with `sc`, weird stuff like that. Taught me a lesson. If I hadn't generated a bunch of seed phrases and looked at them, it would have looked like a "random" seed, but it had a very definite pattern because of my bug

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://github.com/leto/trezor-crypto/commit/edacc1c8f4022e0b017ca0bc22b2145989f34ec7

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
PROTIP: Don't use this seed: ```
$ time ./tools/bip39_mnemonic
pulse useful way cinnamon hen item cause sad vehicle more tortoise bubble unit maple image girl family top blade destroy cross pottery boss again

real    0m0.005s
user    0m0.002s
sys    0m0.002s
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: don't get much easier than that for making seeds. And you can compile this and run it on crazy low-end embedded systems as well
